documents.content: Writing for Malaysian audiences requires understanding of local context: 1) Use of 'lah' and other local particles for casual content 2) Sensitivity to cultural and religious topics 3) Code-switching between English and local languages 4) References to local landmarks and culture 5) Malaysian English conventions.

Business writing in Malaysia: 1) Formal letters should use British English spelling 2) Appropriate honorifics (Dato', Tan Sri) 3) Standard opening 'Tuan/Puan' for formal letters 4) Common closing 'Yang benar' or 'Sekian, terima kasih' 5) Proper formatting for government correspondence.
